result.title: Single Shot: A Little Advice
result.description: Take my advice, you won't want to miss Jerry Seinfeld and his special guests in this episode of Comedians In Cars Getting Coffee: Single Shot!

result.title: Single Shot: This Is Great
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld and his special guests enjoy the finer things in life. Great Cars, Great Coffee and Great Company.

result.title: A Little Hyper-Aware
result.description: Jerry Seinfel and his special guest, Sarah Jessica Parker, sip a Starbucks while driving a 1976 Ford Country Station Wagon to Long Island's Colony Diner...for another cup of coffee.

result.title: Single Shot: Donuts
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld and his guests Tina Fey, Brian Regan and Sarah Silverman converse about the most beloved of all pastries, the donut, in this episode of Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee: Single Shot.

result.title: Two Polish Airline Pilots
result.description: Jerry Seinfel and long-time friend George Wallace laugh about the good old days as they cruise down the Vegas strip in a 1965 Buick Riviera and stop for coffee at the famous Peppermill Restaurant.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is George Wallace (The George Wallace Show).

result.title: Single Shot: Gay Stuff
result.description: Jerry's special guests Alec Baldwin, Larry David, Ricky Gervais, Ted L. Nancy, Sarah Silverman and Howard Stern take their discussions out of the closet in this episode of Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee: Single Shot.

result.title: Opera Pimp
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld and his hero, Robert Klein, cruise around Westchester County, NY, in a '67 Jaguar Mark II to look for lunch and a hot brew and somehow wind up at Sing Sing prison.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is iconic comedian Robert Klein.

result.title: Single Shot: Comedians Love Eating
result.description: Jerry and his laundry list of guests deliberate over the one thing comedians love above all else. Food.

result.title: Episode Trailer

result.title: It's Like Pushing a Building Off a Cliff

result.description: Jerry's special guests Robert Klein, Jay Leno, Don Rickles, Chris Rock and Sarah Silverman discuss the ups and downs of marriage in this episode of Comedians In Cars Getting Coffee: Single Shot.

result.title: Single Shot: The Money
result.description: Jerry and his special guests Louis C.K., Bob Einstein, Joel Hodgson, Seth Meyers and Michael Richards debate the complexities of making the big bucks in this episode of Comedians In Cars Getting Coffee: Single Shot.

result.title: Single Shot: My Parents
result.description: Jerry and his special guests Larry David, Gad Elmaleh, Robert Klein, Jay Leno, Seth Meyers, Sarah Jessica Parker, Don Rickles, Sarah Silverman and Howard Stern reminisce about their humble roots in this episode of Comedians In Cars Getting Coffee: Single Shot.

result.title: Single Shot: New York Life
result.description: Jerry and his special guests Todd Barry, Gad Elmaleh, Tina Fey, Sarah Jessica Parker and Colin Quinn converse about life in The Big Apple.

result.title: Single Shot: Sexy Talk
result.description: Jerry and his special guests Louis C.K., Gad Elmaleh, Bob Einstein, Sarah Silverman, Howard Stern and George Wallace take their discussions to a sexy new level.

result.title: Single Shot: Leno and Letterman on Each Other
result.description: Jerry and his special guests Jay Leno and David Letterman grab a cup and talk about their favorite topic...each other.

result.title: Single Shot: Pee-Pee Time
result.description: Gotta go? Jerry and his special guests Mel Brooks, Larry David, Bob Einstein, Gad Elmaleh, Sarah Silverman, Howard Stern and George Wallace can't hold it any longer as navigate the complexities of toilet time.

result.title: Single Shot: Vocabulary Words
result.description: Jerry and his special guests Alec Baldwin, Larry David, Tina Fey, Robert Klein, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brian Regan and George Wallace confabulate apropos heterogeneous jargon while they luxuriate in coffee's unequivocal piquancy.

result.title: Single Shot: Real Jobs
result.description: Who WANTS to work? Jerry and his special guests Todd Barry, Louis C.K., Robert Klein, Seth Meyers, Patton Oswalt, Brian Regan, Jon Stewart and Colin Quin reflect on the jobs they once had that helped propel them into comedy when they learned...working sucks!

result.title: Single Shot: Coffee or Tea?
result.description: Cream and sugar, or lemon and ice? Jerry and his special guests Larry David, Joel Hodgson and Michael Richards attempt to answer a question as old as time...coffee or tea?

result.title: Single Shot: Hair
result.description: In this episode of Single Shot, Jerry and his special guests Louis C.K., Larry David, Tina Fey, Ricky Gervais and Howard Stern discuss some peoples, Tarzan-like, flowing manes and others shiny lack thereof.

result.title: Single Shot: What is CCC?
result.description: Jerry and the majority of his special guests ask the same question we have been uttering for 3 long years...what is Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee?!

result.title: Season 5 Premiering November 6th
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld is joined by friends for a drive in a classic car and having coffee, sharing stories all along the way. Season 5 premiers November 6th.

result.title: Seinfeld's Meeting With Crackle Prez Gets Tense
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld is urgently called in to the Crackle World Headquarters to speak with the President, Dick Corcoran.

result.title: You Look Amazing in the Wind
result.description: Description: Jerry Seinfeld and his special guest Kevin Hart stylishly cruise around town in a 1959 Porsche RSK Spyder for their 'weird male date.'

result.title: I'm Wondering What It's Like To Date Me
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld and his special guest Amy Schumer check out 'cute bongs' as they walk to a local diner for some coffee after their 1970 Ferrari Daytona breaks down.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is Amy Schumer (Inside Amy Schumer).

result.title: Smoking Past The Band
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld and his special guest Bill Burr cruise around L.A. in a 1970 Ford Mustang like a couple of bosses out on the town in the middle of the day.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is Bill Burr (Date Night).

result.title: Happy Thanksgiving Miranda
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld and his special guest Miranda Sings cruise around town in search of coffee, complaining and apologizing along the way.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is Fred Armisen (Saturday Night Live).

result.title: I Wasn't Told About This...With Special Feature: I'm Dying, Jerry
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld and his special guest Fred Armisen cruise over to Portland's Coava in a 1965 Saab 96 Monte Carlo 850 for some coffee.

result.title: I'm Going To Take A Percocet And Let That One Go
result.description: Jerry and his waspy special guest Ali Wentworth go out for a spin in a low-grill 1970 Mercedes 280SE Cabriolet to grab some coffee.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is Ali Wentworth (Office Space).

result.title: The Unsinkable Legend: Part 2
result.description: Jerry and his special guest Jimmy Fallon finish up their day on the water and head back to the mainland for John's Famous Pancake House and a cup of coffee.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is Jimmy Fallon (The Tonight Show).

result.title: The Unsinkable Legend: Part 1
result.description: Jerry and his special guest Jimmy Fallon cruise over to Jerry's actual car in a 1956 Chevy Corvette convertible to hop aboard yet another vehicle to enjoy some comedic sailing out at sea.

result.title: Season 6 Premiering June 3
result.description: Jerry returns for Season 6, premiering June 3 at 11:30 ET. Riding along are: Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Jim Carrey, Steve Harvey, Stephen Colbert, Bill Maher and Trevor Noah.

result.title: I'll Go If I Don't Have To Talk
result.description: Jerry and the "James Bond of comedy" Julia Louis-Dreyfus reminisce as they share a cappuccino after cruising  the Pacific Palisades in a 1964 Aston martin DB5

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is Steve Harvey (The Steve Harvey Show).

result.title: Always Do The Banana Joke First
result.description: Jerry and Steve Harvey prowl Chicago in a '57 Chevy Bel Air convertible, enjoy some fine cigars and muse about offensive jokes and the futility of comedy class.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is Jim Carrey (Dumb and Dumber).

result.title: We Love Breathing What You're Burning, Baby
result.description: Jerry's full of testosterone as he steps into a '76 Lamborghini Countach with Jim Carrey, who's between a three-week cleanse and a five-day silent retreat. After coffee, it's off to Carrey's studio to study a portrait of a gorilla with a machine gun. Wow.

result.title: The Comedy Team of Smug and Arrogant
result.description: Jerry chooses a 1979 VW Bug police car for good buddy Bill Maher because, as he says, Maher seems to have authority but actually has none. Case in point: when Maher talks politics, Jerry asks, "Boxers or briefs?"

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld' next special guest is Bill Maher (Real Time with Bill Maher).

result.title: That's the Whole Point of Apartheid, Jerry
result.description: Jerry takes incoming Daily Show host Trevor Noah on a tour down under the Brooklyn Bridge, where they riff on football (aka, soccer), apartheid's stupidity, and Noah's insane daily routine.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld's next special guest is Trevor Noah, soon to be host of The Daily Show.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld's next special guest is Stephen Colbert, soon to be host of The Late Show.

result.title: Cut Up And Bloody But Looking Good
result.description: Jerry rides shotgun with Stephen Colbert in a 1964 Morgan Plus 4, a British import that says you just don't care what people think. He's a late-night madman, according to Jerry, who's impressed with Colbert's beard and the manly way he pretends to smoke a pipe.

result.title: Season 7 Premiering December 30
result.description: Jerry is back! President Barack Obama to kick off Season 7.  Will Ferrell, Steve Martin, Garry Shandling, Kathleen Madigan and Sebastian Maniscalco also guest star.

result.title: Season 7 Premiering December 30
result.description: Jerry is back! President Barack Obama to kick off Season 7.  Will Ferrell, Steve Martin, Garry Shandling, Kathleen Madigan and Sebastian Maniscalco also guest star.

result.title: Just Tell Him Youre the President
result.description: For the premiere episode of Season 7, Jerry takes President Barack Obama for a spin in a 1963 Corvette Stingray Split Window Coupe but finds it hard to spirit the leader of the free world off the White House grounds.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld's next special guest is Steve Martin.

result.title: If You See This On A Toilet Seat, Don't Sit Down
result.description: Jerry goes up to the country with Steve Martin in a beautiful but delicate 1954 Siata 8v and come back to the city in something else altogether. In between they converse about confidence, quitting and the best opening lines.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld's next special guest is Kathleen Madigan and Chuck Martin.

result.title: Stroked Out On A Hot Machine
Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry takes a trip to Seinfeld's old New York street set with special guest Garry Shandling.

result.title: It's Great That Garry Shandling Is Still Alive
result.description: Garry Shandling rides shotgun in a 1979 Porsche 930 as he and Jerry goof on Matthew McConaughey and the Dalai Lama during a trip to Seinfeld's old New York street set

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld hops in a classic car with a pal each week to grab a coffee and ponder the things that keep comedians up at night.

result.title: I Don't Think That's Bestiality
result.description: In a perfect combination of guy, car and moment, Sebastian Maniscalco cruises the streets of L.A. with Jerry in a '69 Camaro Z/28 and talks about growing up in a Sicilian family, his grooming habits and having a mean resting face.

result.title: Episode Trailer
result.description: Jerry Seinfeld hops in a classic car with a pal each week to grab a coffee and ponder the things that keep comedians up at night.

result.title: Mr. Ferrell, For the Last Time, We're Going To Ask You To Put the Cigar Out
result.description: Will Ferrell says the secret to his comedy is that he looks like a banker but acts like a nut, which is why Jerry picks him up in a 'happy, silly' 1970 Plymouth Road Runner SuperBird for a mid-day break.
